thread.title: Irish people react in the most Irish way ever to this Brexit puzzle
thread.title_full: Irish people react in the most Irish way ever to this Brexit puzzle

author: Gianluca Mezzofiore
title: Irish people react in the most Irish way ever to this Brexit puzzle
text:
It's Brexit Day ‚Äî when the process of leaving the European Union officially begins ‚Äî and British newspapers really went the extra mile to mark this landmark date in the history of the country.
SEE ALSO: J.K. Rowling uses SpongeBob to sum up her feelings about Brexit
The Guardian , in particular, showed off its creativity with a jigsaw puzzle where Britain's exit is symbolised by the missing pieces corresponding to the country's position in the map.
Tomorrow's Guardian's front page #BrexitEve pic.twitter.com/vAknM6zuxS
‚Äî Katharine Viner (@KathViner) March 28, 2017
It's not Mashable 's Lego Brexit map , obviously, but still a neat job.
However, if attention to detail is your thing, you'd probably notice that designers have removed a bit of the Republic of Ireland as well. Just look closer:
The map seems to suggest that part of the Republic beyond the six counties in Northern Ireland, notably the counties of Donegal and Cavan, have been annexed to Britain and will be leaving the EU.
People noticed and took issue on Twitter:
Jesus. They really are leaving. And by the looks of things, they're taking Donegal and Dundalk with them. #SaveTheTown https://t.co/0G0PnOUOjk
‚Äî Richard Chambers (@newschambers) March 28, 2017
@newschambers Longford was always an affluent, urbane society. More Home Counties than Midlands anyway
‚Äî Eamonn Donohoe (@EamonnDonohoe) March 28, 2017
@andreagilligan @newschambers It took this to take you out Gilligan. Who knew.
‚Äî Ciara King (@iamCiaraKing) March 28, 2017
@newschambers the town? What about donegal üò≥ where will I go!? ü§î
‚Äî Andrea Gilligan (@andreagilligan) March 28, 2017
@newschambers @andymcgeady pretty sure my home town of Arklow is going too üò±
‚Äî Hazel Nolan (@HNolan101) March 28, 2017
@newschambers hey most of the six counties didn't vote to leave but that isn't stopping the Brits.
‚Äî Conor Conneally (@conorconneally) March 28, 2017
A lot of people asking for Donegal and Cavan back. Sure you can give back the rest while you're at it. https://t.co/LB9vLHHL4i
‚Äî Eoghan Doherty (@dohertyeoghan) March 28, 2017
@guardian hands off Donegal and give us our six counties back too.
‚Äî Pearse Doherty (@PearseDoherty) March 28, 2017
Also, #monaghout #westmexit #longfordbrexitpun pic.twitter.com/Sz0S167kUo
‚Äî Gavan Reilly (@gavreilly) March 28, 2017
@RedMistIreland You're the third person to try to give away Offaly. For the last time, they don't want it!
‚Äî Richard Chambers (@newschambers) March 28, 2017
@mckenp @johnauldwebster @newschambers & they wouldn't take Cork
‚Äî JPCampbellBiz (@JP_Biz) March 28, 2017
One user noticed that even Shetland Islands were erased from the map:
Call me parochial but Shetland being erased from the map is a bigger deal. https://t.co/Laf8wLipRh
‚Äî ·¥é·¥Å ô·¥Ö ü¶å (@naebD) March 29, 2017
